questions.question: What is Melbourne Diwali event?
questions.answer: Melbourne Diwali is a grand celebration of the Indian Festival of Lights held in Melbourne, showcasing vibrant Indian traditions, arts, and performances.

questions.question: Is there an entry fee for the event?
questions.answer: Entry is free for all attendees.

questions.question: What can attendees expect at the event?
questions.answer: Attendees can enjoy diverse cultural stalls, food vendors, live performances, art and craft displays, and more, representing the rich tapestry of Indian culture.

questions.question: Is the event weather-proof?
questions.answer: Yes, Melbourne Diwali is the city's biggest undercover, weatherproof event, ensuring a comfortable experience for all attendees.

questions.question: Can I bring my children to the event?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Melbourne Diwali is a family-friendly event with activities and performances suitable for all ages.

questions.question: Will there be food and drinks available at the event?
questions.answer: Yes, there will be a variety of food stalls offering delicious Indian cuisine and beverages.

questions.question: Where is the event being held?
questions.answer:
The event is taking place over three days, across two venues.

Thursday and Friday Nov 9 and 10 @ The District Docklands, 5:00pm – 9:00pm.

Saturday Nov 11, @ Stadium Square, Marvel Stadium ( Gate 2 and 3), 3:00pm – 10:00pm.

questions.question: How can I get to the event venues?
questions.answer:
Both Marvel Stadium and The District Docklands are strategically located with easy transport options for attendees' convenience.
  • For the District Docklands Shopping Centre - Take the Tram 86 or 70 and get down at the last stop Docklands.
  • For Marvel Stadium – Its 3 minutes’ walk from the Southern Cross Station.

questions.question: Why is the event planned at various locations?
questions.answer:
• Different venues planned have their own significance.
  • Harbour Esplanade - is one of the best waterfront venues in Melbourne. We are working closely with City of Melbourne to launch a “HAPPY DIWALI’ sign there. The sign will be approx 24 mtrs in length and backlit. The sign will be visible to thousands of commuters passing by. It will be launched on 16 October 2023 for about a month (till 13 Nov).
  • The District Docklands - is a fantastic inner city Shopping Centre. It is house to some amazing experiences that just add to the shopping experiences. They are a very generous supporter and sponsor for our activities. Together we have organised many great events. They continue to support us and our community initiatives. Additionally, the ease of parking and free public transport makes it an ideal location. The venue is donated very generously for all activities.
  • Stadium Square, Marvel Stadium - It is a new extension of the Stadium. The Stadium itself is one of the best venues for major events and their professionalism and a very supportive management makes them an ideal partner for us. We have access to undercover area capable to host thousands of patrons. With Main screen and multiple big screens throughout the venue, we will be able to ensure that this Diwali is not impacted by weather. Last year over 8 Diwali events got cancelled or rescheduled. We know that there is one event that will definitely not be cancelled or postponed due to weather.

questions.question: What is Marvel Stadium Square?
questions.answer: Marvel Stadium Square is an open-air, multipurpose space at Marvel Stadium.

questions.question: Where can I find Marvel Stadium Square?
questions.answer: Marvel Stadium Square is located around Gates 2 and 3 of Marvel Stadium. It encompasses the outdoor areas adjacent to these gates and is used for event-related activities.

questions.question: How do I get to Marvel Stadium Square?
questions.answer: The square is easily accessible via public transport, with Southern Cross Station being the closest major transport hub. If you're taking a tram, several routes stop near Marvel Stadium. For those driving, parking is available in the surrounding area.

questions.question: Is Marvel Stadium Square part of the indoor stadium?
questions.answer: No, Marvel Stadium Square is not inside the stadium seating bowl. It is an external space that forms part of the stadium's precinct for outdoor events.

questions.question: Is Marvel Stadium Square accessible for people with disabilities?
questions.answer: Yes, the square is designed to be inclusive and accessible, with pathways and facilities that accommodate visitors with disabilities.

questions.question: Marvel Stadium Event Parking
questions.answer:
Marvel Stadium Management - Marvel Stadium Parking (ubipark.com).

Parking on that day will be the event rate. Ensure a hassle-free visit by securing your parking spot early.

questions.question: Southern Cross Station Park
questions.answer: Southern Cross Station Car Park (wilsonparking.com.au).

questions.question: The District Docklands
questions.answer: 90min FREE PARKING | $10 Early Bird (thedistrictdocklands.com.au).

questions.question: Alternative Transport
questions.answer:
Southern Cross Station: Just a 3-minute walk from the festivities, it's the most convenient way to join us without the worry of parking.

Trams: Plenty of tram services are available to Marvel Stadium. Plan your journey with PTV's journey planner to find the best route.

faqs.category: Attendance at Melbourne Diwali at Marvel Stadium Square

questions.question: Do I need a ticket to attend Melbourne Diwali at Marvel Stadium Square?
questions.answer: No, tickets are not required to attend Melbourne Diwali as it is a free event open to all. However, we encourage you to register your attendance.

questions.question: Why should I register if Melbourne Diwali is a free event?
questions.answer: Registering helps us anticipate the number of attendees to ensure everyone has a comfortable and enjoyable experience. It aids in our planning for amenities, security, and entertainment.

questions.question: How do I register for Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer: You can register on the official Melbourne Diwali website (melbournediwali.com.au)

questions.question: What are the advantages of registering for Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer: Registered attendees may receive important updates about the event, a map of the venue, and details about available facilities and services.

questions.question: Will I be denied entry to Melbourne Diwali if I don't register?
questions.answer: No, you will not be denied entry. Registration is for planning purposes and is not mandatory for attendance.

questions.question: Can I bring guests to Melbourne for Diwali?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We welcome you to bring guests. Please encourage them to register as well.

questions.question: What if I can't register online for Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer: You're still welcome to join us at Melbourne Diwali. Online registration is recommended but not compulsory.

questions.question: Is there a cut-off time for registering for Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer: There's no deadline, but early registration is advisable to ensure you receive all pertinent information and updates.

questions.question: Where can I find more details about Melbourne Diwali and the registration process?
questions.answer: For more information and to register, please visit the Melbourne Diwali official website: (melbournediwali.com.au)

questions.question: What are the activities in Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer: Melbourne Diwali Workshops and Activities Schedule.

questions.question: Thursday, 9th November 2023
questions.answer:
Workshops

  • Indigenous Pottery Workshop - Discover the art of pottery with expert guidance. Shape clay into beautiful pots that symbolise prosperity and life.

  • Indian Street Food Experience - Takes you on a culinary journey through the bustling streets of India, with a hands-on food workshop.

  • Henna Workshop: Learn the ancient art of henna painting, and get adorned with traditional and contemporary designs.

  • Dance Workshop with: Move to the rhythm of Indian beats as Basty teaches you some energetic dance moves.

  • DJ: End the night on a high note with DJ Kaushal Patel spinning a mix of Bollywood and global tunes.

questions.question: Friday, 10th November 2023
questions.answer:
Workshops

  • Henna Workshop: Experience the beauty of henna artistry, perfect for those who missed the first workshop.

  • Dance Workshop: A session dedicated to dance enthusiasts, focusing on the grace and vibrancy of Indian dance forms.

  • Indian Street Food Creation: Brings the flavours of India to life, teaching you how to whip up some delicious street food favourites.

  • Dance Performance: Watch as Bhangra Nation ignites the stage with a high-energy performance that will get everyone's feet tapping.

  • DJ Set: The night concludes with another electrifying DJ set, ensuring the festivities continue with great music and dance.

faqs.category: Marvel Stadium Square - Main Event Day

questions.question: Saturday, 11th November 2023
questions.answer:
Kids Activities 3:00pm - 5:00pm

Kids Activities with AFL, North Melbourne, and Melbourne Renegades: A fun-filled afternoon with activities for kids, featuring the AFL, North Melbourne Football Club, and Melbourne Renegades.

Cultural Performances 5:00pm - 8:00pm

A showcase of cultural performances representing the diverse regions of India, from traditional dances to contemporary acts.

Dance Masti Time 8:00pm - 10:00pm

As the evening progresses, the floor opens up for everyone to dance. Join in the 'Dance Masti Time' with rich food and festive stalls surrounding you.

questions.question: Who are the food vendors at Melbourne Diwali?
questions.answer:
Melbourne Diwali is excited to present a diverse array of food vendors, ensuring a delightful culinary experience for all attendees:

Goppi Ka Chatka

Dive into the spicy and tangy world of Indian street food with Goppi Ka Chatka, where each bite is a burst of flavour.

Saravanaa Bhavan

A renowned name for South Indian vegetarian delights, Saravanaa Bhavan will provide a selection of their famous dosas, idlis, and other regional favourites.

Desi Kothi

Step up for a unique twist on Indian desserts with Desi Kothi's Indian ice cream, a perfect sweet treat to enjoy amidst the festivities.

Twista Bros.

For those looking for an innovative culinary twist, Twista Bros. will be serving up fusion snacks and meals that blend different culinary traditions.

Marvel Catering

Catering to those who prefer continental fare, Delaware North will offer a variety of Western-style food options to ensure there's something for every palate.

questions.question: Can I find vegetarian or vegan options at the event?
questions.answer: Yes, food on that day is vegetarian only.

questions.question: Will there be options for those with food allergies?
questions.answer: Guests with food allergies are encouraged to consult with individual food vendors regarding ingredients. Our vendors are prepared to provide this information to ensure the safety and satisfaction of all our guests.

questions.question: Are there cashless payment options available at the food stalls?
questions.answer: Indeed, Melbourne Diwali is a cashless event. All vendors will accept a range of cashless payment methods for a smooth and convenient transaction experience.

questions.question: How can businesses or vendors participate or set up stalls at the event?
questions.answer: • Please visit the Sponsorship page for more information.

questions.question: Why are such huge discounts given to exiting supporters but not new supporters?
questions.answer: We believe in rewarding loyalty. We can not forget any individual, corporates or businesses that have helped us reach this stage. It is our time to give back and we shall continue on this path. We suggest you join us this year to ensure that you get the same treatment in future. We reward loyalty.

questions.question: I am a small business. I want to sponsor but can not afford the charges. Can I do something?
questions.answer:
• At the moment we are trying hard to ensure that we can raise money to cover our costs. We are a charity ourselves and rely on donations and support. In fact, it will be great to be able to raise more money so that we can add more features to the event and make it memorable.
  • However, if you are a local business who have worked with us in the past, please get in touch with us at SME@MelbourneDiwali.com.au and we can discuss possibilities.
  • If you are a member of the Docklands Chamber of Commerce or City Precincts, please contact your leadership. We work closely with them and are planning a special package for their members.

questions.question: I am considering sponsoring this event. But I want to provide something special from our stall such as Coffee, Tea, Balloon, gift etc.
questions.answer:
• That’s great thinking. It is generally a good idea to have some giveaway to attract people to your stand. We will encourage that. Please check our packages to see what is suitable for you.

  • Please note that providing any food item can be tricky and you will need to work with Marvel Stadium Events and/or Catering team. Get in touch with us and we will work with you through the process.

  • When I sponsor, will I be sponsoring the whole event i.e. all days, all venues and all activities or is it for particular day?

  • All sponsors are sponsors for the Melbourne Diwali event.

  • Sponsors will have greater access to certain events, depending on their involvement and interest.

questions.question: What is the Sponsors Lounge/VIP Area. How do we get access to it? Is it open to public?
questions.answer:
• The Sponsor’s Lounge is to acknowledge and support the generous leaders of the community who make such events possible. They come from all walks of life, and it is important to make them feel welcome.

  • The Lounge is akin to the Airport Lounge. Where ticket holders will be able to get in and out at anytime.

  • The Lounge will also host Business Connect and Political Engagements activities.

  • It is undecided yet, but most likely it may not be a kid friendly space due to various forums, panels and discussions taking place there.

  • This area will have a capacity of about 300.

  • We are yet to fully articulate the format of this Lounge, but we believe in inclusion. We are in discussions with the Stadium authorities. We hope to make it accessible for everyone. We hope we can keep the costs limited to between $100 to $150 per ticket.

  • Please note that other than this area, all other areas at the Stadium Square, Gates 2 and 3, across 2 levels will be accessible for all.

questions.question: How many people are expected at the event?
questions.answer:
• 16 October – Launch and Business meet and greet for sponsors – About 150 business and community leaders.

  • 9th and 10th November – The District Docklands events are primarily targetted at local Docklands community. We will be working closely with local schools specially The Docklands Primary School. We expected about 2000 families to participate in activities over 2 days.

  • 11 November – @Marvel we expect about 6000 individuals to participate.

  • For reference – last year we had about 5100 people on main event day. The venue was a small park in Docklands. This year we have a much larger, better and covered venue.

questions.question: How does Political Engagement look like?
questions.answer:
• We believe that it is important to build bridges with people in authority and ordinary residents. Diwali is a perfect opportunity to discuss community successes and concerns with people with influence.

  • We will remain nonpartisan and invite members from all major parties. We have already sent invitations to the Lord Mayor, local State and Federal MP’s, Premier and Leader of Opposition in Victoria.

  • We have also invited Consulate General of India.

  • Many prominent members of our community have also been invited.

questions.question: Last year you provided Free food, free toys and free workshops. Will it still be the same this year?
questions.answer:
• We are changing the format this year. Last year we planned the event for about 2000 people with enough food and toys to serve them. However we received over 5100 people. Due to constant rains it became difficult for us to provide enough food for all.

  • Over 80 volunteers from the two temples worked for days to provide temple food and as is cultural they love to feed people. We ran out of food by about 7PM. It was very sad. We also had to ration toys. Everyone was given a toy, over 1800 kids were given toys from Lego and other brands but the management of distribution became a challenge.

  • We have learnt from it and decided to instead invest our energies and resources to make the experience better.

  • The event on 11 Nov is now going to be professionally managed by Marvel Stadium professionals. They will be managing all vendors compliances, stage, sound, lights, security, cleaning etc.

  • With the help of The District Docklands some free workshops will still happen. Mainly Mehendi, Dance and Indian Street Food Cooking.

  • Pottery painting will not be free as pots are very difficult to secure. We are also trying to bring in a professional Aboriginal artist to conduct workshops. We are yet to finalise the price but it will be between $65 to $110 per family. The participant will be able to pick a Terracotta Vase, learn about Aboriginal art, decorate it with Diwali message and take it home. The vases are premium quality from Bonnie and Neal collection.

  • Sample here: Bonnie & Neil Terracotta Vase – Village Home & Gifts (villagehomeandgifts.com.au)

  • We are in discussions with businesses who may subsidise these workshops and we will get details by first week of October.

questions.question: Is the event pet friendly?
questions.answer:
• It is unclear yet if we can create a safe space for kids. We are working with Management to map it.

  • The event in general will be active with many lights, sounds and movements. It may be disturbing to pets.

  • We will update this section soon.

questions.question: How many people are expected at the event?
questions.answer:
• 16 October – Launch and Business meet and greet for sponsors – About 150 business and community leaders.

  • 9th and 10th November – The District Docklands events are primarily targetted at local Docklands community. We will be working closely with local schools specially The Docklands Primary School. We expected about 2000 families to participate in activities over 2 days.

  • 11 November – @Marvel we expect about 6000 individuals to participate.

  • For reference – last year we had about 5100 people on main event day. The venue was a small park in Docklands. This year we have a much larger, better and covered venue.

  • We will remain nonpartisan and invite members from all major parties. We have already sent invitations to the Lord Mayor, local State and Federal MP’s, Premier and Leader of Opposition in Victoria.
